You can create an VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator indicator object that is not bounded to any automatic update and choose which data it should use. To use it, please refer to the reference table below.

VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator()1/2

            VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator QuantConnect.Indicators.VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator (
    *string                       name,
    Int32                        period,
    *Nullable<Resolution>  resolution,
    *Func<TradeBar>        selector
   )

Creates an VolumeWeightedAveragePrice (VWAP) indicator for the name. The indicator will be automatically updated on the given resolution.

Parameters
*string name (Optional) The custom name of the indicator whose VWAP we want.
Int32 period The period of the VWAP.
*Nullable<Resolution> resolution (Optional) The resolution.
*Func<TradeBar> selector (Optional) Selects a value from the BaseData to send into the indicator, if None defaults to the Value property of BaseData (x => x.Value).

Return

VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator - The VolumeWeightedAveragePrice for the given parameters

Definition at file Indicators/VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator.cs.

VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator()2/2

            IntradayVwap QuantConnect.Indicators.VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator (
    *string  name
   )

Creates the canonical VWAP indicator that resets each day. The indicator will be automatically updated on the security's configured resolution.

Parameters
*string name (Optional) The custom name of the indicator whose VWAP we want.

Return

IntradayVwap - The IntradayVWAP for the specified name

Definition at file Indicators/VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator.cs.


You can use two methods to update the indicator: automatic or manual.

Automatic Update

In this method, you will recreate the basic indicator usage: create the indicator with its constructor and register the indicator for automatic updates with the RegisterIndicator() method, but could be using a custom resolution via a Consolidator.

private VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator _vwap;
// In Initialize()
_vwap = new VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator(period);
_vwap.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _vwap, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_vwap.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _vwap.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.vwap = VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator(period)
self.vwap.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.vwap, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.vwap.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.vwap.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually allows you to control which data is used and create indicators of other non-regular price fields. The indicator objects have the Update() method that updates the state of the VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator indicator with the given a trade bar, a quote bar, or a custom data bar.

With this method, the indicator will only be ready after the Update() method has been used to pump enough data.

private VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator _vwap;
// In Initialize()
_vwap = new VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator(period);

// In OnData()
if (data.Bars.ContainsKey(symbol))
{
    _vwap.Update(data.Bars[symbol]);
}
if (_vwap.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _vwap.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.vwap = VolumeWeightedAveragePriceIndicator(period)

# In OnData()
if data.Bars.ContainsKey(symbol):
    self.vwap.Update(data.Bars[symbol])
if self.vwap.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.vwap.Current.Value
